giant bat.description: A giant bat with sharp fangs and claws!

attack descriptions: The giant bat bit down hard!

giant badger.description: Its a badger! It looks much bigger than a badger should be.

attack descriptions: The giant badger bit down hard!
The giant badger rushed foward with its claws!

healing.description: A simple bottle filled with a sweet liquid.

greater healing.description: A glass bottle filled with an red liquid.

superior healing.description: An ornate bottle filled with a opalescent liquid.

supreme healing.description: An artisan bottle filled with a red, glowing liquid.

smelling salts.description: A vial filled with a pungent substance that can revive a downed player.

The Mad Max.description: This sword is dirty, bloody, and warm to the touch. The blade singes the flesh.

shortsword.description: A dull, old sword likely passed down through the generations.

longsword.description: A craftsman long sword. It has reach and strength thanks to ages old smithing techniques.

greatsword.description: A heavy two-handed sword. It can be difficult to wield, but a masterful swordsman shouldn't have a problem.

double-bladed scimitar.description: A two-bladed scimitar from a foreign land. The extra blade inflicts more damage.

scimitar.description: A curved sword from a foreign land. Impressive and lightweight.

rapier.description: A light sword more akin to a work of art than a killing weapon.

handaxe.description: A simple hatchet. The blade is chipped and dull.

battleaxe.description: A double-edged axe designed more for war than for downing trees.

greataxe.description: A heavy two-handed axe. It can crush armor as much as it can chop flesh.

hand crossbow.description: A small crossbow designed to be fired single handedly. One might wonder what purpose this serves.

light crossbow.description: A simple lightweight crossbow. The wood is a little cracked, but it does the job.

heavy crossbow.description: A hefty crossbow designed to increase the bolt's velocity.

dagger.description: A small dagger. This glorified knife has seen better days. Best for buttering bread.

club.description: A knotted branch one might call a club. Its hefty, but uncomfortable to wield.

great club.description: A large branch cut and shaped into a bludgeoning device. Great for crushing things.

flail.description: A spiked iron ball attached to a handle by a chain. Seems dangerous to enemies and the wielder alike.

mace.description: A heavy iron sphere atop a wooden handle. Great for smashing armor, faces, hands, feet...

morning star.description: The mace's edgy brother. Heavy, sharp, and bad ass.

glaive.description: A long staff that ends in a slim blade.

halberd.description: A long staff that ends in a hefty axe-like curve.

lance.description: A long pole-arm used primarily in jousting.

pike.description: A long shaft with an arrow-like tip. Great for piercing or slashing enemies at a distance.

sickle.description: A farmer's tool not typically used for battle.

hell's ban hammer.description: The spirit of this hammer is said to be the devil himself.

light hammer.description: A small workman's hammer. Used for nailing boards together or bashing in heads.

maul.description: A heavy two-handed hammer. People that use these to crush things flat.

warhammer.description: A lightweight but dangerous hammer used for denting armor.

long bow.description: An artisan bow strung with high tensile string to deliver high speed projectiles.

short bow.description: A typical hunting bow. Great for small and medium game.
